meanings.definition: To create or use a simplified form of language for communication between speakers of different languages.
meanings.sent1: When my friends from different countries visit, I pidginize my speech to help them understand.
meanings.sent2: It is important to pidginize the instructions so that everyone can follow them easily.
meanings.sent3: I tried to pidginize my cat's meows so that my dog could understand, but it just confused them both.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, programmers often pidginize complex coding languages for beginners.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used hand gestures to pidginize the lesson for the hearing-impaired student.

meanings.definition: To adapt a language to make it simpler and easier to understand for non-native speakers.
meanings.sent1: When I travel to foreign countries, I pidginize my English to communicate with locals.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to pidginize their website to attract a global audience.
meanings.sent3: Trying to pidginize Shakespeare's language would probably result in some hilarious misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: She had the ability to pidginize legal jargon into plain language for her clients.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to pidginize the recipe for the international cooking competition.
